attributes.action: Urge the USA not to adopt “Title IX”
attributes.background: The policy, Title IX, would effectively define Transgenderism out of the law. It states that sex is the only determining factor in gender and that it can’t be changed. By suggesting this, the White House would be removing all protections for transgender Americans or individuals who live or visit.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a British issue yet, it is vital that we set up and shut this down. By introducing this policy America becomes an affront to not just LGBT+ rights, but to human rights. Trans rights are human rights and we, the United Kingdom and Europe, have an honourable and proud tradition of guarding these rights and sharing them around the world. If one of our closest trading partners and allies can introduce something like Title IX, and we don’t stop them, then where does that put us?

attributes.action: Create a UK group to design, construct and operate UK nuclear power stations
attributes.background: 51% of all electricity generated in UK is by Gas and Coal powered stations. 21% is generated by old Nuclear plants. We need to replace these with new nuclear power stations. I believe that the UK should design, develop, construct and operate these with UK skills by creating a UK Nuclear Power Group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government should create a UK Nuclear Power Group to manage, design, develop, construct and operate the new Nuclear power stations required for our UK national electricity grid. 
A UK group would not only create thousands of jobs in the UK, using the skills that are developed in the UK and ensure the security of the electric network remained in our control.

attributes.action: Make all recovery trucks and taxis meet all standards of child safety
attributes.background: It is not a legal requirement to have isofix components in recovery vehicles and taxis. We need to change that!
attributes.additional_details: After having a breakdown on a live road at night with a child, we have found out the hard way about this. We purchased the safest equipment for our child and we found ourselves stranded for hours trying to find someone with this capability. Fortunately myself and child got home in a taxi and my husband in the recovery truck. What if I was on my own with a child? We need to make this change for the safety of our children!

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for Supermarkets to give all leftover produce to homeless
attributes.background: The amount of food waste by Supermarket’s in the UK stands at 1.9 million tonnes and that is simply sickening when there are 8 million people living in food poverty today.

attributes.action: H M Forces Veterans ID Card
attributes.background: Following many years loyal service in H M Forces, indeed having been willing to give their life for their country, I think it is time H M Government recognised this service for all veterans by establishing an official MoD H M Forces Form 90V ID card for all those who have served.
attributes.additional_details: The ID card should show the service (RAF, Army etc.), the rank on retiring, dates of service, photo, signature and date of birth, to therefore make it a fully recognised VIC (Veterans Identity Card). The card should also include a PIN facility for electronic use.

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people who kill others and rape children.
attributes.background: Many rapists go into prison and then come out to commit the same crime which is a massive issue with the system today many rape victims feel scared their rapist will try to attack them again. These people who commit these crimes shouldn't be allowed back into society.

attributes.action: Change English law such that an offer on a house is a binding contract
attributes.background: Making it a more binding contract to offer on a house would help speed up moving house and prevent people spending thousands of pounds only for their buyer to withdraw or the seller to accept to a higher bid. This is how the system works in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Twice this year I have accepted offers on my property and spent money in solicitors fees only for them to pull out. I think once an offer is made on a property it should be made harder in law for a person to pull out of buying that property.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to have a dog off lead on or near any public highway.
attributes.background: To protect the general public,drivers, other dog walkers and their dogs, all dogs, no matter how well behaved they may be, should be kept on a lead on or near any road.
attributes.additional_details: I have had three incidents myself recently involving loose dogs, which have been frightening for myself and my dog, but also which could have resulted in accident or injuries. In one incident a dog ran accross a busy road to get to mine, the owner said 'sorry, but he's friendly' - lucky he wasn't 'dead friendly'. I also know personally of several cases where dogs have been attacked by loose dogs, one of which was on their own driveway. Sadly the owners seem to think this is acceptable behaviour.

attributes.action: Educate children and teenagers about Learning Disabilities and Mental Health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will have a mental health illness. 1 in 50 people have a learning disability. These figures are increasing and everyone will come into contact with people with mental health issues and learning disabilities on a regular basis. So it is important to know and understand these disorders.
attributes.additional_details: A lack of understanding and fear of the unknown is causing people with Mental Health and Learning Disabilities to become increasingly vulnerable and separated from society. To integrate everyone, including the Mental health and Learning Disability population, creating awareness and understand should decrease behaviours, such as bullying and mate crime, which is significantly higher for vulnerable people. Educating people from a young age should make these stigmatized groups more accepted.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all red processed meat to carry government health warning
attributes.background:
Back in 2015 the World Health Organisation classified red processed meat as carcinogenic. A group 1 carcinogen known cause cancer. The same category as tabaccco, arsenic and plutonium.
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and failed to make this information widely known to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask for an extensive campaign to infrom the public of the health risks carried by red processed meat products. We expect the government to act responsibly by making it mandatory to include a health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and to ensure the health of our children by removing all processed meat products from the menu within schools and hospitals.

Link to the World Health Organisation on processed meat: 
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Change Marriage Allowance to include cohabiting couples
attributes.background:
Marriage Allowance lets you transfer £1,190 of your Personal Allowance to your husband, wife or civil partner - if they earn more than you.

This reduces their tax by up to £238 in the tax year (6 April to 5 April the next year).
attributes.additional_details: Cohabiting couples are viewed as a married couple for the sake of government benefits, household income and in some cases of possession (entitlement to mortgaged house).

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least £10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: Abolish hospital parking charges for blue badge holders.
attributes.background:
I have a blue badge and have to visit my local hospital frequently, as do many others.

It is unfair that those using this service must lose out by having to pay these charges more often.  Blue badge holders park - by and large - for free in their local area anyway, so why not in hospitals?

attributes.action: Guarantee help for same sex couples to start their own family
attributes.background: I have been with my partner for 3 years now and have looking to start a family for about a year but have been unable to get the funds to go private to get the help to start our own family, I work 40 hours a week full time but after bills go out there is not enough funds to save to go private.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should make sure there is funding for all same sex couples in my position.

attributes.action: Better treatment, education and career possibilities for UK sea faring cadets
attributes.background: Cadets for the most part are taken on for the tax breaks afforded to the companies and as such see no career prospects with their training provider, wages are unliveable on and education should be tailored more towards the role of a sea farer.

attributes.action: Change the overtime law so everyone gets paid all the hours they work
attributes.background: Too many companies can get away with making their employees work over their contracted hours and not pay them for all the hours they work, this is not fair for the people as everyone should be paid for all hours they work, including all overtime hours they do.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/overtime-your-rights

This is the section of law which needs changed to make it fair for all employees regardless of job title, as it states the employers do not need to pay their employees overtime as long as the total hours worked does not drop their pay to below the national living wage, how can this be seen as a fair and just system.

attributes.action: Have a referendum allowing all the UK a vote on Scotland’s Independence.
attributes.background: In 2014 Scotland had an independence vote on whether to remain in the UK or become an independent country.  The rest of the UK did not get to vote on if we wanted Scotland to remain.  Allow all UK citizens, including the Scottish to debate and vote on Scotland’s continued membership in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban the use of premium rate phone numbers completely.
attributes.background: These numbers are charged at a truly enormous rate and  there seems to be no legitimate need for these at all.

attributes.action: Invest at least 1% of the new Digital Tech Tax to tackle online abuse!
attributes.background: Sexism, harassment and abuse happens both on and offline. It also disproportionately affects and silences women. It is time the government took this problem seriously. It is time law enforcement caught up with online crime and time tech companies delivered real support to the users they profit from.
attributes.additional_details:
On 29 October the Chancellor announced a new digital tech tax on companies like Facebook and Twitter. We are calling for at least an annual 1% to be spent on:

1) The £200,000 that the Home Secretary announced in 2017 to spend on a UK Hate Crime Hub
2) Public education campaigns on online abuse
3) Increase police resources and capacity to adequately investigate and prosecute online abuse
4) Pilot an e-Safety Commissioner focused on e-safety of women and girls and ending online abuse

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Government to provide further funding and resources to Veterans UK
attributes.background: Veterans UK administers the armed forces pension schemes & compensation payments for those injured or bereaved through service. In 2014, the Head of Veterans UK stated that the processing time for new claims was 4 months. In 2018, Veterans UK acknowledge that this it is now far in excess of this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/armed-forces-veterans-waiting-long-7572677.amp

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-28656924

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11035262/Are-we-failing-traumatised-war-veterans.html

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all unpaid carers receive appropriate training
attributes.background: Adult unpaid carers save the UK economy billions of pounds each year and despite being under supported, carers are delivering cost effective day to day invaluable care and support which for most carers becomes a full time job. Carers should have a legal right to receive appropriate ongoing training
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities are charged with supporting unpaid carers under the care act. Local authorities already ensure regular routine training and support packages to other carers, I.E. foster carers, with a dedicated support team which is made available 24/7. Local authorities should be legally bound to manage, support, provide and ensure ongoing training for unpaid carers. Without certified training, unpaid carers are being left vulnerable, unprotected and isolated.

attributes.action: Require bookmakers to give the same offers to shop and internet customers.
attributes.background: Bookmakers have promotional offers that are only available to online customers. These should be available in shops. A lot of older people have been using shops since the early sixties, these people are not computer literate and they are being denied the offers that online account customers receive.

attributes.action: Reduce the drink-drive limit to 0.05, reducing it to 0.02 in a few years
attributes.background: I was watching Trust me I'm a Doctor on the BBC and the drink drive limit has not been altered since inception in 1967, despite science moving on. When it was set at 0.08, it was believed this doubled the risk of a fatal collision, it is now known to be 13 times higher.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety expert Professor Richard Allsopp, who set the original limit, states that he would now not choose that limit. He recommends a reduction to 0.05 (the same as Scotland), reducing to 0.02 in a few years (the same as the rest of Europe). He estimated that the reduction to 0.05 would save 25 lives a year. I want the Ministry of Transport to implement this and accept that the limit is currently far too high for safety. Ours is one of the highest blood alcohol limits in the world.

attributes.action: Demand the Government clarify the legal status of Windrush Generation
attributes.background: The British Nationality Act 1948 created the status of  "Citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies" allowing the Windrush Generation to stay in the UK as Citizens, if their status has changed please clarify which act changed this, if not publicly state the Windrush Generation are all citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
Relevant legislation is as follows:
Summary of British Nationality act 1948 - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Nationality_Act_1948
Summary of Commonwealth immigration act 1962 -https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_Immigrants_Act_1962
Summary of Commonwealth immigration act 1968 -https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_Immigrants_Act_1968
Summary of Immigration Act 1971 - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immigration_Act_1971

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Ban child targeted advertising on unhealthy foods.
attributes.background: We have a huge obesity problem in the UK, yet we're targeting young children when selling unhealthy foods. Walking around the supermarket, I regularly see chocolate bars with Paw Patrol characters on the wrappers. This is shocking and needs to be stopped if we have any chance in tackling obesity.

attributes.action: Shale gas to guarantee no costs to taxpayers or impact on aquifers.
attributes.background: No subsidies, no research funds. More people in the UK oppose fracking than support it. Taxpayers do not want taxes spent on assisting or supporting shale gas extraction. All the costs of shale exploration and extraction must come from the companies not the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details: Costs to be measured and paid for include: noise abatement; air quality compensation; replacing damaged aquifers with access to undamaged aquifers; subsidence and seismic damage restoration; and policing. Costs must be covered in full costs before permission for any exploration or extraction is given. Money would be better spent helping protect water supplies in droughts, preventing flooding in storms, and improving NHS and care services.
attributes.creator_name: Catherine Ann Phillips CEnv CEng FIMECHE CMIOSH PIEMA MSc BEng (Hons) PGCert

attributes.action: Reform schools’ complaints system
attributes.background: The Department for Education refuse to investigate complaints from innocent students who suffer school bullying or targeting by school staff/other authorities by not obtaining all the relevant records needed for a fair investigation. We need a new body to investigate failures over the last 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Reform the system as bullying ruins the lives of victims regardless of age or disability this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints from students/parents against schools & local authorities where children have been forced out of school, expelled, parents labelled & false reports made. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims lose out on schooling, self-harm or even take their own life. This cannot be right.

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Utility companies to move elderly customers onto the cheapest available tariff.
attributes.background: Many elderly citizens are paying excessive amounts for gas, electricity and water. Make it law that utility companies must automatically place them on their cheapest available contracts at the time of renewal, not just place them on a standard expensive tariff.
attributes.additional_details: Utility markets are a competitive marketplace, and rightly so. Contract renewals are generally based around internet "Compare" websites that many elderly do not understand how to use. Electric and Gas suppliers are exploiting this fact by not moving them onto the best contract at renewal time. This is wrong and should be legislated against.

attributes.action: A Fair Parenting law so that both parents get equal child benefits.
attributes.background: Parents should receive benefits - Child Benefit, Disability Benefit or Carers allowance - for the period their child stays with them.
attributes.additional_details: Parents, particularly disabled parents, need help to feed and clothe their child for the time their children are with them. Parents are having to use food banks because the benefits that should follow the child stay with the resident parent no matter where the child is actually staying.

attributes.action: Over turn the proposed ban on log burners and open fires
attributes.background:
How will the government's anti-pollution strategy affect you?
Heavily-polluting log burners and open-fire fuels will be banned

Please sign the petition to over try and over turn this ban
attributes.additional_details:
Many people depend on their wood burners and open fires as their main source of heat. Frankly life would not be worth living in the winter months without a real fire. Many elderly people use open fires, this is their only form of heat.
Burning wood is a natural process whereas burning fossil fuels is an unnatural process. Without burning wood the only source of heat will be through oil, gas or electricity all of which produce pollutions in their own form far more serious than burning wood.

attributes.action: That the Care Quality Commission Regulate Personal Alarm Services
attributes.background: My Mother died on Royal Wedding Day last year after being left on the floor for 78 minutes after using her personal alarm. They did not call an Ambulance.
attributes.additional_details: These services should be regulated.

attributes.action: Test for Category D Should entitle license holder to drive Class 2 ( Vice versa)
attributes.background: I strongly believe (Along with many HGV ancoach drivers) that if you pass the driving test for buses (Category D) this should then entitle the license holder to drive any vehicle up to 7500 kg.
attributes.additional_details: On a category D licences you can drive an 18000kg Tri Axle coach but not a 7500kg truck. Although the coach may be longer and taller. This doesn’t make any sense. I also believe that with Category D on your license, you should be able to tow any trailer on your car when over the age of 25.

attributes.action: Make it law to have every pet microchip registered to national insurance number
attributes.background: If every pets microchip was registered to the owners national insurance number any pets dumped, lost and stolen etc would be able to be traced to their owner even if microchip details are out dated.
attributes.additional_details: Too many dogs/ pets get dumped without any trace from their owners who walk away Scot free..everybody has a N.I and will always be able to be traced.

attributes.action: Referendum asking Britain if there should be a second Brexit referendum.
attributes.background: There are many people calling for a second EU referendum and many people calling for the 2016 result to be upheld. Let’s ask the people if we should indeed have a second referendum with the question: Should there be a second EU referendum to determine whether Britain stays in the EU? Yes or No.

attributes.action: Lower Minimum Age of Full "A" Motorcycle License to 20 Through Direct Access
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that you could no longer get a full size motorcycle at 18 and was changed to 24
attributes.additional_details: You currently can get a full license through progressive access at 21 but that means you have to take your A1 and A2 tests before you can get it and obviously plus your CBT

attributes.action: Put the negotiated Brexit deal to the electorate.
attributes.background:
The government has negotiated a bad Brexit deal.
If this deal is the only one available from the EU this and the other options of no deal and remain should be put to the electorate for a mandate. Politicians cannot agree a way forward and no one can honestly say what was voted for in 2016
attributes.additional_details:
Minority government with no mandate for any current option. Historical failure to inform public debate by failure to place relevant data, reports and documents into the public domain in a timely manner. Lack of public trust in motives and actions of many politicians.
Without a mandate any decision - deal, leave with no deal or remain -risks alienation of a large proportion of the electorate and will set back future progress after that decision has been made. 
Democracy requires public engagement

attributes.action: Clarity on the conditions in which Sec. of State for NI would call a border poll
attributes.background: In absence of clarity in the Good Friday Belfast agreement, I wish to request the Secretary of state for NI clarify the conditions that must be met to call a border poll on Irish reunification.

attributes.action: Change the curriculum to provide greater mental health support in education.
attributes.background:
bangthedesk.com is campaigning to change the curriculum and reform the education system.

Suicide is the leading cause of death among young people in the UK; this peaks in exam season.

We can statistically prove the damaging affect of stress on young people, so why are we doing nothing to help?
attributes.additional_details:
Bang The Desk is petitioning the government to make the following changes to the UK school curriculum:

1. Remove formal testing for anyone under the age of 18.

2. Increase funding for the arts. 
​
3. Introduce an hour of wellbeing into the curriculum every day.

4. Start and end every school day with 10 minutes of mindfulness.

5. Greater mental health support across all educational institutions; mandatory counselling once a month for every student.
​
6. Better wages and support for teachers.

attributes.action: Cap life insurance premiums for applicants with Mental Health problems.
attributes.background: I was medically discharged from the Armed Forces in 2016 and with this dramatic change in my life I suffered with depression and an adjustment disorder, a problem I still suffer with.  After a battle with myself I finally built up the courage to get the help I needed, but It has now taken me 2 years
attributes.additional_details: to find a company that will actually give me life insurance and within this search was point blank refused cover by multiple insurers.   After allowing an insurer to obtain a targeted medical report from my GP they have offered to cover me, but I was shocked that there was around a 200% premium increase compared to that of my wife’s. The added financial burdens will not only deter people from getting help but will also add more pressure to those affected and may hinder recovery.

attributes.action: Make 11 November a public holiday in remembrance of the two world wars.
attributes.background: In Britain we divide our remembrance between Remembrance Sunday that takes place on the nearest Sunday to 11 November and 11 November itself which recently has gained in importance. The designation or 11 November as a public holiday would do justice to the sacrifice that we try to remember.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has stood under the canopy of the Menin Gate in Ypres at 8 pm and heard the last post being sounded, as it has been every evening since 1924, save for the particular circumstances of the 2nd World War, cannot fail to be moved. The designation of 11 November as a national day of remembrance and a public holiday would allow us to do justice to the sacrifice of so many that took place100 years ago.

attributes.action: Devolve the suburban rail services in London to Transport for London.
attributes.background: The suburban railways in and around London that are operated by private companies are in a bad state with delays, cancellations and general bad quality of service. TfL operated services are some of the most reliable services in the country and have seen significant improvements since TfL took over.
attributes.additional_details:
TfL's plans for devolution released back in 2016 but rejected by the DfT, seemingly for no reason at all: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network
Chris Grayling's letter to Boris Johnson detailing how he was putting politics over devolution of service in London: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/dec/07/chris-grayling-accused-of-putting-politics-over-people-in-rail-letter-leak

attributes.action: Require smoke masks in high rise buildings to assist evacuation in a fire.
attributes.background: The safe evacuation of a high rise building would be greatly improved if residents have access to emergency smoke and oxygen masks. The masks would reduce the potentially life threatening effects of smoke inhalation and improve the chances of safe evacuation. The masks cost less than £50 currently.
attributes.additional_details: Emergency fire services are provided with breathing apparatus to access buildings on fire. Clearly providing modest masks for residents exiting a building through smoke filled lobbies and staircases would be of benefit. Moreover the masks would provide additional reassurance to residents.

attributes.action: Ease the employment restrictions on asylum seekers.
attributes.background: Asylum seekers are restricted to jobs on the National Shortage Occupation List [SOL]; the reason behind their unemployed. The support they receive is inadequate for daily life [£5.39/day]; forcing them to live in poverty; relaxing the terms will make lives less vulnerable for those already in agony.
attributes.additional_details:
People seeking sanctuary in the UK could contribute £42m/year; if the work restrictions were non-existent. Millions are being spent to support destitute asylum seekers each year; this capital is possible to retain & make better use of. 

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-appendix-k-shortage-occupation-list

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/oct/16/asylum-seekers-could-contribute-42m-to-uk-if-work-rules-relaxed

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-45100120

attributes.action: Abolish fines for parents requesting absence from school.
attributes.background: My mum wanted to take my three little sisters on holiday abroad. She nor my sisters have seen my grandmother in nine years, and now that have finally been able to save up to go during Christmas time, they risk being fined £60 per child per leave of absence.
attributes.additional_details: All of my sisters have excellent attendance, why should my mum have to pay over £900 pounds for missing five days of school?
